content.content: According to the Special Voting Cycle #9a: Protocol Delegation Program proposal, the below protocols have qualified for the Protocol Delegation Program in Season 3. There will be a recorded onboarding call on January 23rd at 19:00 GMT to go over the requirements of the program (including proper delegate commitment guidelines) and to introduce protocols to the Optimism governance process.  The following 15 protocols have qualified based on gas fees generated in Season 2 and have opted-in to participate in Season 3 governance. 100% of the below protocols have opted-in to participate with the understanding that a 70% voting participation rate is required. 100% of the below protocols have agreed to abide by the delegate code of conduct. Protocol name: Uniswap Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/190 Protocol name:  LayerZero Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/195?u=maxpower Protocol name: Velodrome Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/165 Protocol name: Rubicon Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/182 Protocol name: Pika Protocol Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/186 **** Protocol name: 0x Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/191 Protocol name:  Hop Protocol Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/180 Protocol name: Nested Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/184 Protocol name:  Socket Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/194 Protocol name: PoolTogether Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/141 Protocol name:  Mirror Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/189 Protocol name: BeethovenX/Balancer Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/192 Protocol name: Curve Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/201 Protocol name: Clipper Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/200 Protocol name: Odos Link to delegate commitment: https://gov.optimism.io/t/delegate-commitments/235/199  The following 8 protocols have been elected to participate in the program and will be required to properly upload delegate commitments before receiving delegation: Protocol name: ENS Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/20 Protocol name: Thales Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/12 Protocol name: Kwenta Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/18 Protocol name: Lyra Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/19 Protocol name: Paraswap Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/5 Protocol name: Connext Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/14 Protocol name: Polynomial Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/16 Protocol name: dHEDGE Link to self-nomination: https://gov.optimism.io/t/protocol-delegation-self-nominations/4357/21  You can see the delegation amount each protocol will receive, according to the criteria outlined in the protocol delegation proposal
content.GPT-summary: The post explains the Protocol Delegation Program for Season 3 and lists the protocols that have qualified for the program. It also provides links to the delegate commitments of each protocol. The post does not ask for feedback or collaboration, but it does provide information for interested parties and extends an invitation to participate in the program.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
